Posts.Content: jsz wrote: Can anyone explain BI-RADS and T2 signal abnormality? After an MRI my doctor scheduled an ultrasound biopsy, yet when I read the report I got conflicting interrpretations. The 'lesion' as they refer to it, is BI-RADS 'O', 1.1cm.  Another spot was BI-RADS 3,  3 mm, and suspected to be benign. I have a strong family history of breast cancer (mother and Aunt) and no one is forth coming with information. I'm not liking the sounds of this, don't want to panic, but don't want to not be concerned either. Should I be looking for referrals for surgeons at this point? BTW, I'm 55, same age as my mother when she was diagnosed 30 years ago. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bi-Rads and T2 jsz nowheregirl

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2008 12:26AM jsz wrote: Thanks for your response. I do have alot of questions and will make sure to ask!  I will also probably need to find a doctor at some point, as this all came from my annual OBGYN checkup.
